Just jumped from a 25 chat restriction to a 15 day ban over this

I dont see any point in playing after my ban is up. All it would take is a few salty players to report me, and my account would be banned for good.

Really really put off by how little riot considers their player base. To just implement something like the Instant Feedback system that obviously cant do the important task of handling reports.

This is riots generic response

"Hello,

Thanks for writing in and I apologize for the delay in getting back to you. We have been seeing a higher than usual amount of tickets these last few days.

Checking your account it looks like you had already gotten sets of chat restrictions in the past. As a result of continued negativity it has now resulted in this suspension. With our Instant Feedback system accounts will generally be issued punishments on an escalating path which looks like this:

10 chat restrictions->25 chat restrictions->2 week suspension->Permaban

Any negative behavior that would result in a penalty (even chat restrictions) will bump an account up the next step. I totally get that games can get frustrating at times but that never excuses responding to that negativity with more negativity. Berating others when things go wrong just makes things worst for everyone. Remember, you are responsible for your own behavior only and it doesn't matter who "started it."

I don’t want to see you lose your account and in the future I highly suggest using chat only for when it will contribute to the success of your team. If you don’t have anything positive to say it just might be best to say nothing at all. In my games I always prefer to instantly mute those players that are being negative as it isn’t worth giving them the attention they want.

Legendary
Player Behavior & Game Support
Jarvan IV Jungle
"For the King!""

Im going to do what ever i can legally to get my refund for all ive spent on this game and close my account for good. With the touchiness of this system, and already being on 3rd level restrictions(that never go down by the way)

Just because it's your opinion does not make the way it is expressed not toxic. Calling other players trash, children, pathetic, etc. is insulting, disrespectful, and unsportsmanlike, all of which is against the Summoner's Code, which asks you to treat other players with respect and courtesy.

>If stating my opinion(if its not racism homophobic or threatening) is against the rules of league of legends that is just ridiculous. And there's no reason to be part of a community like that.

Then I would honestly suggest you find another community. If *League's* idea of respectful community interaction does not fit your personal desires in a gaming community, there are others out there that may.

Best of luck to you in other gaming endeavors.

Riot's policy is that toxicity is not acceptable, period. Hate speech/threats/etc are worse, certainly, but that doesn't mean other toxicity is not (or should not) be punished.

> You can not comment on my punishment because it is unjustified with the given information. whether you believe it or not.

Ultimately neither your beliefs or mine matter here. Riot's policies are what matters, in much the same way that, regardless of how much either of us things we should be able to, say, loudly insult other patrons in a movie theater, doing so will get us kicked out. It is a company's legal right to enforce behavioral expectations in their real-world or virtual venues as they see fit.

My goal here is to share feedback based on my knowledge of Riot's policies, not my personal opinion.

> But letting slip "ur trash" once over 6 months warrants 15 day ban and next level perma ban. Be serious no one in their right mind would agree with that.

Had you received any previous punishments? If so, how recently? Because this in and of itself seems unlikely to have earned an immediate 15-day ban from a fresh account.

6 months is typically enough to drop, provided your behavior is good. My suspicion with this log is that you've been riding the line for a while, and that it finally pushed you over -- or that you simply haven't played much in that time. The usual estimate is 3-5 months.

> or the Instant Feedback system takes a joke out of context or something.

If you're not making jokes where the "humor" arises from taking insults in the manner in which they were perhaps intended, you will not encounter this issue in the future. Remember that people on the internet may not know how you intend a statement, or may not find casual insulting amusing or enjoyable.

> Chat bans should be handed out all the time.
> But Gameplay bans should require Gamebreaking behavior such as intentionally feeding or going afk.

Riot tried extended chat bans in the past and found them unsatisfactory in terms of how they dealt with toxicity. It's a good idea, certainly, but it's one that was tried precise for that reason, and ended up not really being as good in practice as it was in theory.

Are you trying to argue it's not worth a 14-day ban cos it's not that severe?

There are 4 tiers of punishment:

1. 10 game chat restriction
2. 25 game chat restriction
3. 14-day ban
4. permaban

Extreme toxicity can make you skip punishment tiers, but unless your punishment level decayed (done by playing alot of games), you will move up the punishment ladder every time you get punished.

Mild toxicity over many many many many many games will eventually get someone permabanned.

The 2 games you were shown are recent examples of unacceptable behavior. It doesn't mean you were solely punished for these two games alone.
